I disagree with this. E should remain targeted. I don't get this obsession with making everything skill shots. Targeted damage and CC, even if it is a slow, is still very viable in this game, and very necessary for dealing with the disgusting amount of mobility in the game. 

Blood Boil, on the other hand, I do agree with 100%. The skill is dated and needs to replaced with something else. 

As for the lack of hard CC everyone keeps mentioning - you can still be a good support without stunning or rooting someone. If stuns and roots are handed out like candy, they become cliche and the champs with them become less unique. Nunu dealing in heavy slows is perfect as it is, and I do think they can refine him without resorting to default stuns/roots that they use with every champion these days.

With my suggestions i was taking the direction of him being a dedicated jungler. The reason i like the idea of a skill shot is it allows you to put more power into the ability without it becoming broken. And it also makes the champion more fun to play because there is more skill involved thus you are more rewarded for using this ability successfully. It's just good game design. 
The reason why i think he needs hard CC is because of his tank playstyle. Without hard CC he's going to get outclassed by almost every tank in the game. It will also help solidify his jungle playstyle since it will actually allow him to gank effectively in this hypermobile state of the game. (idea: his ult could provide the same form of cc as {{champion:69}} W along with the slow) Even that little bit of hard(ish?) CC would help him immensely. 
Also could you name me a good support that doesn't have at least 1 form of hard CC? I can't think of any.

Nunu, in general, is pretty much useless.

His only hope is to make his enemies more useless than himself through slows and counter jungling.

He's on the list for a VGU for a reason.  He is about giving stats to your team and taking away stats from the opposing team.  As a result, he is very unsatisfying to play because historically speaking, giving/ taking away stats one of the most unsatisfying ways to give power, even if the power is worth hundreds of gold.  Look at Gangplank's old E or Taric old ult.   Then notice how they were removed and were replaced with much more interesting abilities.  They were just stat boosters that left the player with the feeling "Wow, I do absolutely nothing", even if the abilities were strong at the time.  I can almost guarantee you that with Warwick's rework, his Attack Speed boost will be removed from his kit for this reason.

Everyone's complaining about his abilities, but has anyone noticed his passive? It encourages you to AA on a tank mage, I mean it's an even worse version of Lissandra's passive. As for his model, it looks NOTHING like his splash, with willump going from a muscle-bound furry white behemoth to a baby-blue old guy with a quiff and a beer-gut.

Riot, if you're not doing it already, put this sucker on the champ update production line.
He is on the champ update line. But he's fairly low priority since there are kits in greater need. But we can expect a full update at some point.
